name: (3-chloropropyl)trimethoxysilane
Reason: 3-chloropropyl is a functional group that can significantly impact the melting point. The basic unit for comparison can be trimethoxysilane, which has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the 3-chloropropyl group increases the molecular weight and size, which raises the melting point. The chlorine atom also introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. The propyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The silicon atom and oxygen atom within the siloxane bond also contribute to the melting point, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius.
